name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Nova Scotia research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Nova Scotia ancestors.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for research resources. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about finding your ancestors in Nova Scotia.

    ☆ FS Wiki:—Nova Scotia—Finding Your Ancestors

  2. Get an introduction to genealogy on the Nova Scotia GenWeb site.

    ☆ Nova Scotia Genealogy

  3. Explore resources for Nova Scotia research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Nova Scotia Resources

  4. Explore the Genealogy Guide on the Nova Scotia Archives site.
  5. Learn about resources for finding ancestors in Nova Scotia.

    ☆ Finding Your Ancestor in Nova Scotia
    ☆ AA—Nova Scotia Genealogy

  6. Learn about Atlantic Canadian resources for research.

    ☆ AA—Atlantic Canadian Resources at NEHGS—58:27



  7. Use the Nova Scotia Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Nova Scotia Record Selection Table

  8. Explore a variety of records on the FreeCanadianAncestry site.

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Nova Scotia archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Nova Scotia archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.

content.text:
1. Learn about Nova Scotia archives and libraries in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Nova Scotia Archives and Libraries

  2. Learn about resources available on the Nova Scotia Archives site.

    ☆ Genealogy Guide

choices.name: Learn about Nova Scotia city directories.

content.text:
1. Learn about Nova Scotia city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Nova Scotia Directories

  2. Explore city directories in Nova Scotia on the CanGenealogy site.
  3. Find additional resources for city directories on the Nova Scotia Archives site.
  4. Explore township records on the Nova Scotia Archives site.

name: Vital and Census Records
section_name: Learn about Nova Scotia vital and census records.

choices.name: Learn about Nova Scotia vital and birth records.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for vital and birth records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Nova Scotia vital records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Nova Scotia Vital Records

  2. Explore Nova Scotia vital records on the Nova Scotia Archives site.
  3. Read this case study in Nova Scotia vital record research, from Olive Tree Genealogy.

    ☆ OT— Using Search Engine Tools Provided to Find an Ancestor

  4. Learn about adoption records on the OriginsCanada site.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for census records. Then use the learnings for searches for an ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Get an overview of Nova Scotia censuses in this article.

    ☆ FS—Nova Scotia Census

  2. Explore Nova Scotia census and poll tax records on the Nova Scotia Archives site.
  3. Explore the MyFreeCensus site for Nova Scotia province and county census records.
  4. Download census information files from the Nova Scotia GenWeb site.

hidden.content:

  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about and search Nova Scotia death records.

    ☆ FS: Nova Scotia Death Records

  2. Explore death record resources on the Death Indexes site.
  3. Explore Nova Scotia obituaries on the In Memoriam site.

QUIKLinks

content.text:

  2. Explore Nova Scotia church records on the Nova Scotia Archives site.

hidden.content:

  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Explore Nova Scotia cemetery records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Nova Scotia Cemetery Records

  2. Explore Nova Scotia cemetery records on the Nova Scotia Archives site.
  3. Browse the Interment.net site for Nova Scotia cemetery records.
  4. Search for records from various Nova Scotia cemeteries on the AcadianGenweb site.
  5. Search the Find A Grave site for cemetery records.
  6. Search the BillionGraves site for cemetery records.

QUIKLinks

name: Emigration and Immigration
section_name: Learn about Nova Scotia emigration and immigration.

choices.name: Learn about Nova Scotia emigration and immigration.

content.text:
1. Learn about Nova Scotia emigration and immigration in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Nova Scotia Emigration and Immigration

  2. Learn about New England planters who migrated from Rhode Island to Nova Scotia.

    ☆ AA—Researching New England Planters to Nova Scotia—72:00



  3. Learn about Acadian settlers in Nova Scotia in this American Ancestors article.

    ☆ AA—Acadian Genealogy

  2. Learn about Nova Scotia land and property records.

name: Maps and Gazetteers
section_name: Learn about Nova Scotia maps and gazetteers.

choices.name: Explore Nova Scotia maps and gazetteers.

content.text:
1. Explore the David Rumsey collection of Nova Scotia maps.
  2. Explore the map collection on the Nova Scotia archives site.
  3. Explore the Canadiana maps collection.
  4. Explore the Perry-Castaneda site for maps of Nova Scotia (search for Nova Scotia on the page).
  5. Explore historical Nova Scotia maps on the Historic Map Works site. Select North America, Canada, and Nova Scotia in the drop-down menus.
  6. Find Nova Scotia towns and communities on the RoadsideThoughts site.
  7. Search for Nova Scotia place names on the John Cardinal site.

1. Learn about Nova Scotia newspapers in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Nova Scotia Newspapers

1. Find links to Nova_Scotia newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  2. Explore Nova Scotia newspaper resources on the CanGenealogy site.
  3. Search Nova Scotia newspapers in the onlinenewspapers.com site.
  4. Search the Nova Scotia Online Historical Newspapers site.
  5. Search Nova Scotia newspapers in the world-newspapers.com site.
  6. Search Nova Scotia newspapers in the ABYZ News Link site.
  7. Explore Nova Scotia newspaper resources on the Ancestor Hunt site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Nova Scotia research.

content.text:
1. Explore links on the CanGenealogy site.
  2. Explore links in Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore links in GenealogyLinks.net.

choices.name: Use QUIKLinks to quickly search record collections for Nova Scotia.

content.text:
• QUIKLinks are indicated by lightning-bolt icons in the Goal header area and in the page.
  • QUIKLinks point to collections with 50,000 or more records.

1. Explore the FamilySearch page for online genealogy records.
  2. Explore additional record collections in Ancestry.
  3. Explore additional record collections in Findmypast.
  4. Explore additional record collections in MyHeritage.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Nova Scotia research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Nova Scotia Genealogy page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Genealogical Association of Nova Scotia page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Acadian Genealogy Facebook page.
  4. Find additional Facebook pages for Nova Scotia genealogy on the Genealogy on Facebook site.

choices.name: Join a mailing list or message board for Nova Scotia research.

content.text:
1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Nova Scotia research.
  2. Search the RootsWeb site for Nova Scotia research mailing lists.
  3. Explore the Nova Scotia research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.

choices.name: Learn about Nova Scotia genealogy societies.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Nova Scotia in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Nova Scotia Societies

  2. Explore the Genealogical Association of Nova Scotia site.

  3. Explore Nova Scotia genealogy society sites on Cyndi's list.
  4. Get help at a family history center in Nova Scotia.
